intro: Neobracea acunana, commonly known as the Andean lily, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Neobracea acunana is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in high-altitude ecosystems.
